OK, so the problem is that the auto-generated derivatives for the in-place functions are constructed such that they use the input (which has to be cloned, so it defeats the memory savings). They should be using the output instead.

I'll fix gen_variable_type.py.

@lantiga, when you implement #3874 you'll want to make sure that the derivative formulas for in-place functions use output/result instead of self. For example,

lantiga@eb14fa6#diff-8026a1a389bfcf92e484ae272675c336R702

should be

self: threshold_backward(grad, output, threshold, value)

body:
OK, so the problem is that the auto-generated derivatives for the in-place functions are constructed such that they use the input (which has to be cloned, so it defeats the memory savings). They should be using the output instead.

I'll fix `gen_variable_type.py`.

@lantiga, when you implement #3874 you'll want to make sure that the derivative formulas for in-place functions use output/result instead of self. For example,

https://github.com/lantiga/pytorch/commit/eb14fa6d2fe578bb91f461516ddee163742a3145#diff-8026a1a389bfcf92e484ae272675c336R702

should be

```
self: threshold_backward(grad, output, threshold, value)
```
